title: Get does not syncing on ropsten network
body:
#### System information

Geth version:
````
Geth
Version: 1.6.7-stable
Git Commit: ab5646c532292b51e319f290afccf6a44f874372
Architecture: amd64
Protocol Versions: [63 62]
Network Id: 1
Go Version: go1.8.3
Operating System: linux
GOPATH=
GOROOT=/usr/local/go
````

OS & Version: Linux CentOS 7

#### Expected behaviour
- Running `geth --testnet --networkid 3`
- Node starts syncing

#### Actual behaviour
- Nothing happens after message `INFO [07-24|17:09:29] IPC endpoint opened: /root/.ethereum/testnet/geth.ipc`
- Node does not start syncng

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
- Create droplet/instance on DigitalOcean provider (I suspect that any other with CentOS 7 is good too)
- Download binary geth from there: `https://gethstore.blob.core.windows.net/builds/geth-linux-amd64-1.6.7-ab5646c5.tar.gz`
- Unpack to `/opt/geth`
- Run `/opt/geth/geth --testner --networkid 3`

#### Backtrace

````
[root@alexp ~]# /opt/geth/geth --testnet
WARN [07-24|17:09:29] No etherbase set and no accounts found as default 
INFO [07-24|17:09:29] Starting peer-to-peer node               instance=Geth/v1.6.7-stable-ab5646c5/linux-amd64/go1.8.3
INFO [07-24|17:09:29] Allocated cache and file handles         database=/root/.ethereum/testnet/geth/chaindata cache=128 handles=1024
INFO [07-24|17:09:29] Writing custom genesis block 
INFO [07-24|17:09:29] Initialised chain configuration          config="{ChainID: 3 Homestead: 0 DAO: <nil> DAOSupport: true EIP150: 0 EIP155: 10 EIP158: 10 Metropolis: 9223372036854775807 Engine: ethash}"
INFO [07-24|17:09:29] Disk storage enabled for ethash caches   dir=/root/.ethereum/testnet/geth/ethash count=3
INFO [07-24|17:09:29] Disk storage enabled for ethash DAGs     dir=/root/.ethash                       count=2
WARN [07-24|17:09:29] Upgrading db log bloom bins 
INFO [07-24|17:09:29] Bloom-bin upgrade completed              elapsed=145.568µs
INFO [07-24|17:09:29] Initialising Ethereum protocol           versions="[63 62]" network=3
INFO [07-24|17:09:29] Loaded most recent local header          number=0 hash=419410…ca4a2d td=1048576
INFO [07-24|17:09:29] Loaded most recent local full block      number=0 hash=419410…ca4a2d td=1048576
INFO [07-24|17:09:29] Loaded most recent local fast block      number=0 hash=419410…ca4a2d td=1048576
INFO [07-24|17:09:29] Starting P2P networking 
INFO [07-24|17:09:29] UDP listener up                          self=enode://4c77ab89d8902d06006c7e1e079f02c77e9188ec151df0948bb7c0500cc0834090a7a8365800a18279ebfe70c5191394e91b625353da4cbf4a3bd0a75c241059@[::]:30303
INFO [07-24|17:09:29] RLPx listener up                         self=enode://4c77ab89d8902d06006c7e1e079f02c77e9188ec151df0948bb7c0500cc0834090a7a8365800a18279ebfe70c5191394e91b625353da4cbf4a3bd0a75c241059@[::]:30303
INFO [07-24|17:09:29] IPC endpoint opened: /root/.ethereum/testnet/geth.ipc 
````
Actually I running it under unprivileged user, this example is only for demosntration purposes.

I just tried it our now, and it seems to work:

```
~$ geth --testnet --port=30305
INFO [07-25|14:56:41] Starting peer-to-peer node               instance=Geth/v1.7.0-unstable/linux-amd64/go1.8.3
INFO [07-25|14:56:41] Allocated cache and file handles         database=/home/karalabe/.ethereum/testnet/geth/chaindata cache=128 handles=1024
INFO [07-25|14:56:41] Initialised chain configuration          config="{ChainID: 3 Homestead: 0 DAO: <nil> DAOSupport: true EIP150: 0 EIP155: 10 EIP158: 10 Metropolis: 9223372036854775807 Engine: ethash}"
INFO [07-25|14:56:41] Disk storage enabled for ethash caches   dir=/home/karalabe/.ethereum/testnet/geth/ethash count=3
INFO [07-25|14:56:41] Disk storage enabled for ethash DAGs     dir=/home/karalabe/.ethash                       count=2
INFO [07-25|14:56:41] Initialising Ethereum protocol           versions="[63 62]" network=3
INFO [07-25|14:56:41] Loaded most recent local header          number=0 hash=419410…ca4a2d td=1048576
INFO [07-25|14:56:41] Loaded most recent local full block      number=0 hash=419410…ca4a2d td=1048576
INFO [07-25|14:56:41] Loaded most recent local fast block      number=0 hash=419410…ca4a2d td=1048576
INFO [07-25|14:56:41] Starting P2P networking 
INFO [07-25|14:56:43] UDP listener up                          self=enode://5fd1aa4c8c3f08f5ec4bc697f122292e5fd32b22288f9fe1f7ef7578d089e6d4c30a0bd0b45e68afdb4c071f50ad943eeb570bc3868cd221e4e8183cb932a0c1@[::]:30305
INFO [07-25|14:56:43] RLPx listener up                         self=enode://5fd1aa4c8c3f08f5ec4bc697f122292e5fd32b22288f9fe1f7ef7578d089e6d4c30a0bd0b45e68afdb4c071f50ad943eeb570bc3868cd221e4e8183cb932a0c1@[::]:30305
INFO [07-25|14:56:43] IPC endpoint opened: /home/karalabe/.ethereum/testnet/geth.ipc 
INFO [07-25|14:57:13] Block synchronisation started 
INFO [07-25|14:57:14] Imported new state entries               count=1 flushed=0 elapsed=273.843µs processed=1 pending=17 retry=0 duplicate=0 unexpected=0
INFO [07-25|14:57:14] Imported new state entries               count=5 flushed=0 elapsed=443.386µs processed=6 pending=97 retry=0 duplicate=0 unexpected=0
INFO [07-25|14:57:14] Imported new state entries               count=2 flushed=0 elapsed=186.134µs processed=8 pending=129 retry=0 duplicate=0 unexpected=0
INFO [07-25|14:57:14] Imported new state entries               count=89 flushed=0 elapsed=5.743ms   processed=97 pending=1553 retry=0 duplicate=0 unexpected=0
```

Please make sure that your network allows your node to have UDP and TCP network traffic towards the internet and doesn't block you.
@karalabe you are  right, after updating iptables it works. switch `--verbosity 5` showed that `geth` was unable to open port.

I have 6 Ether at https://ropsten.etherscan.io/address/0xacdb28b4e1308d188bf05a7fa38c3427c6352eb9 , And I have Ethereum running on my localhost with following command

 geth --testnet --syncmode "fast" --rpc --rpcapi db,eth,net,web3,personal --cache=1024  --rpcport 8545 --rpcaddr 127.0.0.1 --rpccorsdomain "*" 

However when I run, 

 web3.fromWei(web3.eth.getBalance('0xacdb28b4e1308d188bf05a7fa38c3427c6352eb9'),'ether').toString(10)

in my truffleconsole, its displays 0 as balance
